quest.name: The Crystal from Beyond
journal: Nemjiji nods at you as if she was expecting your arrival.

As you stroll through Archons' Design, you are hailed by a Lalafellin researcher who introduces herself as Nemjiji, assistant to one Professor Claudien and tasked with the study of the aetherial sea. She explains that they have recently discovered a crystal of unknown nature, and asks that you take a look in the hopes that you have seen such a thing on your journeys. Nemjiji takes her leave and asks that you come to Claudien's laboratory in Aporia at your soonest convenience.

Claudien introduces himself and quickly moves to the matter of the crystal, found during a routine observation around the time the exodus was declared. You recognize it immediately as one of the ancients' design, and at a touch, it reveals to you a warning and a plea that you come to “Pandæmonium.” While much remains shrouded in mystery, it is plain that said location is not of this time... Thus does Claudien ask that you return to the past and seek the one to whom the crystal once belonged.

As you approach the portal in the Ocular, it responds to the crystal in your hand. You step past the threshold and are soon overcome by a blinding light, and when you open your eyes, you find yourself in Elpis with a massive headache. Next to you is a youth with striking features, lying on the ground as if he has been knocked down by some unknown force... How odd. Though your arrival seems to have surprised him─particularly in its trajectory─his demeanor suggests that he is eager to make your acquaintance.

Themis explains that he has been tasked with finding out what has happened within Pandæmonium, a facility which houses a menagerie of dangerous creations used for research purposes. Several days ago, irregular aether was detected in its vicinity─ere communications ceased entirely. For the moment, at least, it seems that your goals align.
objectives: Journey to the Ocular and approach the portal.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: Hehe, it appears my calculations were correct! I knew that at this very spot, I would encounter none other than Forename, the hero who saw us through the Final Days. So certain was I of my math that I stood here for... Well, let's not concern ourselves with that.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: I am Nemjiji, assistant to one Professor Claudien. We work with the Aitiascope, to observe the aetherial sea and delve into its myriad mysteries.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: Some mysteries, though, are beyond even our capabilities to unravel... The strange crystal we but recently discovered, for instance, defies our every conjecture.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: You've been to the center of the star and far beyond it, however, so we hope that you may see something in this crystal that we academics do not. I beg you lend us your well-traveled eye at Aporia─Professor Claudien will be eagerly awaiting your arrival.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: Welcome, welcome. We appreciate any insight you can provide on the matter of this crystal. Professor Claudien will share the particulars with you.

dialogue.name: RUISSENAUD
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe, it really is you! I assumed Nemjiji was simply attempting to “pull one over” on me, as it were. Perhaps I should pay more heed to her wild claims.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename, and welcome to my humble laboratory. I am sure Nemjiji has already told you plenty about us, but allow me to introduce myself personally. I am Claudien, leader of this little research collective.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: I must admit, I have been nervous about this meeting ever since Nemjiji set out to find you. For a researcher in my field, there is no greater an honor than to meet the first womanman in history to traverse the aetherial sea and return to tell the tale.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: The professor speaks often and at length of your deeds, but he has no small number of achievements to his own name. He has peered deeper into the aetherial sea than any other in Sharlayan, and the breadth of his knowledge is peerless.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Peerless, perhaps, but for a single womanman... We must seize this precious opportunity to learn what we can from herhim, and perhaps crack this conundrum that has stumped the three of us for moons.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: It was we who peered into the fathomless sea from the Antitower in the Dravanian hinterlands. There we spoke with Hydaelyn, and learned of the fate that would befall this star─the Final Days.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Soon thereafter all research was moved to Labyrinthos, and through the Aitiascope did we continue our vigil. As impressive a work as the device is, however, it can glimpse but a fraction of the sea's infinite depths.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Which brings us to the matter at hand. Not long after the exodus was declared, we recovered an unusual crystal shard during a routine observation. It appeared before us suddenly, as if propelled to the surface by some unknown force.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: We found that it possessed an aetherial density that exceeds that of normal crystals by orders of magnitude. And its shape resembles nothing which occurs in the natural world─it was made, not formed.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, that was the extent of the information we could glean before we were forced to turn our focus towards the exodus. The crystal was very nearly forgotten amidst the sudden upheaval.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: But thanks to the efforts of a certain someone, that crisis is now behind us, and we are free to resume our research.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Thus did we decide to seek you out─the dauntless adventurer who delved into the unknown and beheld its innermost secrets. And now we would have you see for yourself...

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Here is the crystal in question.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: If it resembles aught you have encountered before, even by the smallest degree, please say so.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Memory abides within this crystal.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I know of someone who bears a similar crystal.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: As I thought, you do know what this is! Please, tell me everything.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: I see. The Ascians use these to transfer their memories to new vessels. Fascinating indeed.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: It was plain that this crystal was special somehow, but this revelation surpasses even my considerable expectations.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: Similar artifacts have appeared throughout the ages. Memories of martial techniques manifested as crystalline shards on the battlefield, or storied stones passed from master to student...

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: A comparison between said artifacts and this crystal may prove a fruitful first step in unveiling its true nature. What do you think, Professor?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Ascian memories... Windows through which we can gaze upon the Convocation of Fourteen...

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Unlike the crystal in Forename's story, this one does not bear the mark of the Convocation. Who, then, could these memories belong to?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: And more importantly, why were they stored in this particular shard? More importantly still, why was it set adrift on the aetherial sea?

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: Professor! Pro. Fess. Or! Claudien!

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Huh... Yes?

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: I'm well aware that contemplation is the key to breakthrough, but there is propriety to consider. We have a guest─one you invited explicitly. Must we do this every time?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: What...? Ah! Yes, of course, our guest! Terribly sorry─I do so easily find myself unmoored by the tides of rumination...

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps a more, er...engaging use of your time with us would be for you to take up that crystal. If indeed there are memories stored within, they may reveal themselves to you upon contact.

dialogue.name: SEOULCRYSTAL
dialogue.text: (-Faint Voice-)If anyone...message...come...Pandæmonium... Please...

dialogue.name: SEOULCRYSTAL
dialogue.text: (-Faint Voice-)...faces...grave threat...star...in danger!

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: That expression does not bode well... What did you see?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: ...“Pandæmonium”? 'Tis not a word I have heard before. If my knowledge of the ancient tongue serves me, it means “all demons.” Not a name that inspires optimism, all things considered.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: In the event that another star-shattering cataclysm is in fact bearing down upon us, I would have the aforementioned examples of crystallized memory to hand. Nemjiji, Ruissenaud─I entrust their procurement to you. If there are more memories to be extracted from this crystal, we will find them.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: As for you, Forename, there is a person I would have you seek─the one who has delivered so dire a warning.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Your story tells us that this crystal could very well have been made by one of the ancients.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: If that is the case, then discerning the nature of this “Pandæmonium” would require a trip far into the past. To an era before the sundering.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: I know of only one individual capable of such a feat─the very hero who traversed time to prevent the world's doom.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: I must confess, the tales people tell of your adventures beggar belief, and their veracity has been a subject of much debate among my peers. After today's meeting, however, there can be no doubt in my mind that every incredible exploit is fact.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: So I ask you now─return to the past. Find out what and where Pandæmonium is, and if we need be concerned by this message.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you. For the time being, you should keep the crystal in your possession. I do not think you have seen the last of its memories, and more may be drawn out as you approach their source. Safe travels, and may we meet again soon to share our findings.

dialogue.name: SEOULCRYSTAL
dialogue.text: (-Faint Voice-)If...receives this message...

dialogue.name: SEOULCRYSTAL
dialogue.text: (-Faint Voice-)Come...Pandæmonium...quickly!

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: (-Confused Boy-)Could it be...?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: (-Confused Boy-)...No, of course not. Apologies, but for the briefest moment I thought you to be a dear friend of mine. I realize now that such a notion is preposterous.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: (-Confused Boy-)SheHe told me a falling star would appear before me, and I suppose you must be it. Truth be told, I did not expect the expression to be so...literal.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Ah, apologies for not introducing myself properly. My name is Themis. As you can see by my bare face, I am not one of Elpis's observers.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Rather, I am come here on an assignment, which has been more or less routine up until this very moment...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: You certainly do know how to make an entrance. I must wonder what brought you here, for it is plain that you do not belong here─or any place I know, for that matter.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm Azem's familiar.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm also here on an assignment.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Hmm, it appears my initial impression was not so preposterous after all. I did not know my friend had such a unique familiar at herhis disposal.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: If you are here at Azem's behest, then I believe I can hazard a guess as to your purpose. You are here to investigate Pandæmonium, yes?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Hmm...are you here to investigate Pandæmonium, perchance? It would not surprise me should we share a purpose...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: If so, we may be able to help one another. But first, might I trouble you to explain how you came to collide with my skull?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I see. I believe that dispels any major doubts I had concerning your intentions. Apologies for being so intrusive, but you must understand this is an uncommon occurrence.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I shall pry no further, for I am well aware that we all have secrets we must keep. However, if I may, I would very much like to take a look at this crystal of yours.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Fascinating. While I cannot say much as to what it contains, it is clear that there are memories stirring within.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Memories that speak of something gravely amiss in Pandæmonium...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: The facility extends beneath Elpis, and is overseen by the Words of Lahabrea.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: It houses those creations that are highly valued as research subjects...and highly dangerous to the star. Naturally, it is strictly guarded, and under constant surveillance.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Several days ago, however, an unnatural shift in the flow of its surrounding aether was detected. Soon thereafter, all communications from Pandæmonium ceased.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I am here as representative of an organization that works directly with the Convocation, and have been tasked with investigating this incident.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Now that there is some measure of transparency between us, might I offer a suggestion as to what we should do next?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: During the course of your investigation, you may discover valuable artifacts.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These can be exchanged for equipment by speaking with Mylenie in Aporia or Djole in Radz–at–Han.
